description: Encourages pretend play and imagination.
parent_instruction: Arrange stickers, paper neatly. Start by showing a simple version of the activity. Encourage your toddler to experiment and make choices. Offer prompts like 'What happens if you try this?' Stay engaged but avoid controlling the play.

description: Supports fine motor development through manipulation.
parent_instruction: Prepare the area by placing bottles, rice, beans within easy reach. Invite your toddler to explore the activity step by step. Ask open‑ended questions and celebrate small efforts. Stay nearby to supervise.

parent_instruction: Gather paper tubes, cars and create a safe play zone. Explain what your toddler can do with the items. Let them explore freely while you narrate actions or provide gentle challenges to build skills.

description: Helps children build confidence through self-directed play.
parent_instruction: Set up a simple space for the activity. Provide bird seed, scoops. Show your toddler how to begin, then encourage them to try. Describe what they are doing and offer gentle guidance. Keep the activity relaxed and fun.

description: Promotes creativity while strengthening coordination.
parent_instruction: Prepare the area by placing sponges, water, tray within easy reach. Invite your toddler to explore the activity step by step. Ask open‑ended questions and celebrate small efforts. Stay nearby to supervise.

description: Helps children build confidence through self-directed play.
parent_instruction: Prepare the area by placing feathers, glue within easy reach. Invite your toddler to explore the activity step by step. Ask open‑ended questions and celebrate small efforts. Stay nearby to supervise.

description: Encourages imagination through tactile play.
parent_instruction: Set up a simple space for the activity. Provide buttons, cups. Show your toddler how to begin, then encourage them to try. Describe what they are doing and offer gentle guidance. Keep the activity relaxed and fun.

description: Toddlers explore new textures and actions safely.
parent_instruction: Lay out buttons, cups on a table or floor. Explain the goal in simple words. Demonstrate the action once, then let your toddler explore independently. Support them only if they struggle or ask for help.

description: Promotes creativity while strengthening coordination.
parent_instruction: Lay out foam letters on a table or floor. Explain the goal in simple words. Demonstrate the action once, then let your toddler explore independently. Support them only if they struggle or ask for help.

description: Supports early learning through guided interaction.
parent_instruction: Place sponges, water, tray out in front of your toddler. Begin by modeling the first step of the activity with slow movements. Invite them to join in, praising attempts. Supervise closely if small objects are involved.

description: Promotes creativity while strengthening coordination.
parent_instruction: Arrange magnets, metal tray neatly. Start by showing a simple version of the activity. Encourage your toddler to experiment and make choices. Offer prompts like 'What happens if you try this?' Stay engaged but avoid controlling the play.
